Html:
The sample works fine but if I follow the tutorial right up to the point were you add Java script, I tried following the tutorial and I get run time errors so I tried copy/paste and get run time errors the tutorial leaves alot of stuff out so following it dose not seem to be the way to go for instance nowhere in the tutorial

There shouldn't be any JavaScript errors in any major browser.  I'd suggest downloading the current CodePlex release of the Nerd Dinner code, and compare that with what you've got.

Yes I have the current that was released on March 10 the jquery-1.2.6.js, jquery1.2.6.min.js, jquery-1.2.6.min-vsdoc.js, jquery-1.2.6-vsdoc.js are not the jquery files that com with ASP.NET MVC templatewhen you create a new project you get  jquery-1.3.2.js, jquery1.3.2.min.js, jquery-1.3.2min-vsdoc.js, jquery-1.3.2-vsdoc.js  and the tutorial would not  not work with them it would be nice if the tutorial when a little further explaining the step by step or atleast used 1.0 code I even went as far as replacing all the script files and the page and partiale page with the ones from the sample it looks like they used a prerelease version I'm am jus goin to end up draging and droping everything and stop wasting my time reading
Take a look at the latest source from the "Source Code" page. It uses jQuery 1.3.2.

I had the same problem and it was the missing script attribute in the head of the site.master file that was the problem:

<head>
...
    <script src="/Scripts/jquery-1.2.6.js" type="text/javascript"></script> 
</head>

Seems that this should be included in the tutorial.

Thanks curlyfries
That could have very well been the problem I did so much copy and paste to get it working Ic ould have put that in I'm finding it hard to learn MVC because the tutorials and even the walkthrougs on MSDN leave alot out they start off fine and then they go off on a tangent  I guess if you allready knew MVC you could do the tutorials without any problem but if you where that good at it what would you need to do the tutorials for I spend more time fishing around with the bugs than I do learning MVC
Thanks agian
